00026   UBinary::UBinary()
00027     : type(BINARY_NONE)
00028     , allocated_(true)
00029   {
00030     common.data = 0;
00031     common.size = 0;
00032   }
00033 
00034   UBinary::UBinary(const UBinary& b, bool copy)
00035     : type(BINARY_NONE)
00036     , allocated_(copy)
00037   {
00038     common.data = 0;
00039     if (copy)
00040       *this = b;
00041     else
00042     {
00043       // Be safe, do not try to guess which is bigger.
00044       image = b.image;
00045       sound = b.sound;
00046       message = b.message;
00047       type = b.type;
00048     }
00049   }
00050 
00051   UBinary::UBinary(const UImage& i, bool copy)
00052     : type(BINARY_IMAGE)
00053     , image(i)
00054     , allocated_(copy)
00055   {
00056     if (copy)
00057     {
00058       image.data = static_cast<unsigned char*> (malloc (image.size));
00059       memcpy(image.data, i.data, image.size);
00060     }
00061   }
00062 
00063   UBinary::UBinary(const USound& i, bool copy)
00064     : type(BINARY_SOUND)
00065     , sound(i)
00066     , allocated_(copy)
00067   {
00068     if (copy)
00069     {
00070       sound.data = static_cast<char*> (malloc (sound.size));
00071       memcpy(sound.data, i.data, sound.size);
00072     }
00073   }

00075   void
00076   UBinary::clear()
00077   {
00078     if (allocated_)
00079     {
00080       free(common.data);
00081       common.data = 0;
00082       common.size = 0;
00083     }
00084   }
00085 
00086   UBinary::~UBinary()
00087   {
00088     clear();
00089   }
00090 
00091   UBinary& UBinary::operator= (const UBinary& b)
00092   {
00093     if (this == &b)
00094       return *this;
00095 
00096     clear();
00097 
00098     type = b.type;
00099     message = b.message;
00100     common.size = b.common.size;
00101     switch(type)
00102     {
00103       case BINARY_IMAGE:
00104         image = b.image;
00105         break;
00106       case BINARY_SOUND:
00107         sound = b.sound;
00108         break;
00109       case BINARY_NONE:
00110       case BINARY_UNKNOWN:
00111         break;
00112     }
00113     common.data = malloc(common.size);
00114     memcpy(common.data, b.common.data, b.common.size);
00115     return *this;
00116   }
00117 
00118   int
00119   UBinary::parse(const char* message, int pos,
00120                  const binaries_type& bins,
00121                  binaries_type::const_iterator& binpos, bool copy)
00122   {
00123     std::istringstream is(message + pos);
00124     bool ok = parse(is, bins, binpos, copy);
00125     // tellg() might be -1 if we encountered an error.
00126     int endpos = is.tellg();
00127     if (endpos == -1)
00128       endpos = strlen(message) - pos;
00129     return (ok ? 1:-1) * (pos + endpos);
00130   }
00131 
00132   namespace
00133   {
00137     static
00138     std::string
00139     headers_get(std::istringstream& i)
00140     {
00141       std::string res;
00142       int c = 0;
00143       while (!i.eof()
00144              && (c = i.get()) && c != '\n' && c != ';')
00145         res.append(1, c);
00146       if (i.eof())
00147         GD_ERROR("unexpected end of file while parsing UBinary headers");
00148       else
00149       {
00150         // Skip the delimiter.
00151         if (c == '\n')
00152         {
00153           if (i.peek() == '\r')
00154             i.ignore();
00155         }
00156       }
00157       // Remove leading/trailing spaces.
00158       boost::algorithm::trim(res);
00159       return res;
00160     }
00161   }
00162 
00163 
00164   bool
00165   UBinary::parse(std::istringstream& is,
00166                  const binaries_type& bins,
00167                  binaries_type::const_iterator& binpos, bool copy)
00168 
00169   {
00170     // LIBPORT_ECHO("Parsing: {" << is.str() << "}");
00171     if (binpos == bins.end())
00172     {
00173       GD_ERROR("no binary data available");
00174       return false;
00175     }
00176 
00177     // Validate size.
00178     size_t psize;
00179     is >> psize;
00180     if (is.fail())
00181     {
00182       GD_FERROR("cannot read bin size: %s (%s)", is.str(), psize);
00183       return false;
00184     }
00185     if (psize != binpos->size)
00186     {
00187       GD_FERROR("bin size inconsistency: %s != %s", psize, binpos->size);
00188       return false;
00189     }
00190     common.size = psize;
00191     if (copy)
00192     {
00193       common.data = malloc(common.size);
00194       memcpy(common.data, binpos->data, common.size);
00195     }
00196     else
00197     {
00198       common.data = binpos->data;
00199       this->allocated_ = false;
00200     }
00201     ++binpos;
00202 
00203     // Skip spaces.
00204     while (is.peek() == ' ')
00205       is.ignore();
00206 
00207     // Get the headers.
00208     message = headers_get(is);
00209 
00210     // Analyse the header to decode know UBinary types.
00211     // Header stream.
00212     std::istringstream hs(message);
00213 
00214     // Parse the optional type.  Don't check hs.fail, since the type
00215     // is optional, in which case t remains empty.
00216     std::string t;
00217     hs >> t;
00218     UImageFormat image_format = parse_image_format(t);
00219     if (image_format != IMAGE_UNKNOWN || t.find("image_")==0)
00220     {
00221       type = BINARY_IMAGE;
00222       image.size = common.size;
00223       // In some cases (jpeg source), image size is not present in headers.
00224       image.width = image.height = 0;
00225       hs >> image.width >> image.height;
00226       image.imageFormat = image_format;
00227     }
00228     else if (t == "raw" || t == "wav")
00229     {
00230       type = BINARY_SOUND;
00231       sound.soundFormat = parse_sound_format(t);
00232       sound.size = common.size;
00233       hs >> sound.channels
00234          >> sound.rate
00235          >> sound.sampleSize >> sound.sampleFormat;
00236     }
00237     else
00238     {
00239       // GD_FWARN("unknown binary type: %s", t);
00240       type = BINARY_UNKNOWN;
00241     }
00242 
00243     return true;
00244   }
00245 
00246   void UBinary::buildMessage()
00247   {
00248     message = getMessage();
00249   }
00250 
00251   std::string UBinary::getMessage() const
00252   {
00253     switch (type)
00254     {
00255     case BINARY_IMAGE:
00256       return image.headers_();
00257     case BINARY_SOUND:
00258       return sound.headers_();
00259     case BINARY_UNKNOWN:
00260       {
00261         bool warned = false;
00262         std::string res = message;
00263         foreach (char& c, res)
00264           if (c == '\0' || c == '\n' || c == ';')
00265           {
00266             if (!warned++)
00267               GD_FERROR("invalid UBinary header: "
00268                         "prohibited `\\n', `\\0' and `;' will be "
00269                         "smashed to space: %s",
00270                         libport::escape(message));
00271             c = ' ';
00272           }
00273         // Remove leading/trailing spaces.
00274         boost::algorithm::trim(res);
00275         return res;
00276       }
00277     case BINARY_NONE:
00278       return "";
00279     }
00280     unreachable();
00281   }
00282 
00283   std::ostream&
00284   UBinary::print(std::ostream& o, int kernelMajor) const
00285   {
00286     if (2 <= kernelMajor)
00287     {
00288       o << libport::format("Global.Binary.new(\"%s\", \"\\B(%s)(",
00289                            getMessage(), common.size);
00290       o.write((char*) common.data, common.size);
00291       o << ")\")";
00292     }
00293     else
00294     {
00295       // Format for the Kernel, which wants ';' as header terminator.
00296       o << libport::format("BIN %s %s;",
00297                            common.size, getMessage());
00298       o.write((char*) common.data, common.size);
00299     }
00300     return o;
00301   }
00302 
00303   std::ostream&
00304   operator<< (std::ostream& o, const UBinary& t)
00305   {
00306     return t.print(o, ::urbi::kernelMajor(o));
00307   }
